anomalies.message: Spelling errors in written amount (“FOUN” vs. FOUR; “FISTY” vs. FIFTY”)

raw_text:
MoneyGram
PAY TO: SARAH CHEN
MONEYGRAMⓇ
MONEY ORDER
9021056789
AMOUNT:
$450.00
DATE:
OCTOBER 26, 2024
FOUN HUNDRED FISTY AND 00//100 DOLLARS
FROM: MICHAEL LEE
456 PINE ST, ANYTOWN, CA 91234
9835647821
Michael Lee
AGENT AUTHORIZED SIGNATURE

ai_analysis.summary: Written amount contains clear spelling errors (“FOUN” and “FISTY”), indicating document tampering.
reasoning: Raw OCR text shows “FOUN HUNDRED FISTY AND 00//100 DOLLARS,” with two misspellings in the amount‐in‐words.
Training data indicates 45% of fraud cases involve amount mismatches or altered text.
Numerical amount ($450.00) superficially matches, but the incorrect spelling demonstrates manual alteration or counterfeit printing.
ML model scores are low, but spelling‐error detection overrides model confidence per policy.
key_indicators: Spelling errors in written amount (“FOUN” vs. FOUR; “FISTY” vs. FIFTY”)
actionable_recommendations: Contact MoneyGram fraud department to confirm validity of serial number 9021056789.
Obtain a fresh copy or photograph under different lighting to inspect print and security features.
Verify purchaser’s ID and signature on file with the issuing agent.

reasons: Raw OCR shows “FOUN HUNDRED FISTY AND 00//100 DOLLARS,” misspelling both number words.
Indicates manual or third‐party alteration of the professionally printed amount.
